Events.text: Nero, later to become Roman emperor, is given the title princeps iuventutis (head of the youth).

Events.html: Martyrdom of Saint Adrian of Nicomedia.

Events.text: Croatian Knez Trpimir I issues a statute, a document with the first known written mention of the Croats name in Croatian sources.
Events.html: Croatian Knez Trpimir I issues a statute, a document with the first known written mention of the Croats name in Croatian sources.

Events.text: Translation of the relics of martyr Wenceslaus I, Duke of Bohemia, Prince of the Czechs.
Events.html: Translation of the relics of martyr Wenceslaus I, Duke of Bohemia, Prince of the Czechs.

Events.text: Frederick I Barbarossa is elected King of Germany.
Events.html: Frederick I Barbarossa is elected King of Germany.

Events.text: The Battle of the Sit River is fought in the northern part of the present-day Yaroslavl Oblast of Russia between the Mongol hordes of Batu Khan and the Russians under Yuri II of Vladimir-Suzdal during the Mongol invasion of Rus'.
Events.html: The Battle of the Sit River is fought in the northern part of the present-day Yaroslavl Oblast of Russia between the Mongol hordes of Batu Khan and the Russians under Yuri II of Vladimir-Suzdal during the Mongol invasion of Rus'.

Events.text: Ramathibodi becomes King of Siam.
Events.html: Ramathibodi becomes King of Siam.

Events.text: Władysław II Jagiełło (Jogaila) is crowned King of Poland.
Events.html: Władysław II Jagiełło (Jogaila) is crowned King of Poland.

Events.text: Wars of the Roses in England: Lancastrian King Henry VI is deposed by his House of York cousin, who then becomes King Edward IV.
Events.html: Wars of the Roses in England: Lancastrian King Henry VI is deposed by his House of York cousin, who then becomes King Edward IV.

Events.text: Explorer Christopher Columbus arrives back in Lisbon, Portugal, aboard his ship Niña from his voyage to what is now The Bahamas and other islands in the Caribbean.
Events.html: Explorer Christopher Columbus arrives back in Lisbon, Portugal, aboard his ship Niña from his voyage to what is now The Bahamas and other islands in the Caribbean.

Events.text: Hernán Cortés arrives in Mexico in search of the Aztec civilization and its wealth.
Events.html: Hernán Cortés arrives in Mexico in search of the Aztec civilization and its wealth.

Events.text: The Massachusetts Bay Colony is granted a Royal charter.
Events.html: The Massachusetts Bay Colony is granted a Royal charter.

Events.text: English King Charles II declares war on the Netherlands marking the start of the Second Anglo-Dutch War.
Events.html: English King Charles II declares war on the Netherlands marking the start of the Second Anglo-Dutch War.

Events.text: John Flamsteed is appointed the first Astronomer Royal of England.
Events.html: John Flamsteed is appointed the first Astronomer Royal of England.

Events.text: Charles II grants a land charter to William Penn for the area that will later become Pennsylvania.
Events.html: Charles II grants a land charter to William Penn for the area that will later become Pennsylvania.

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: The Continental Army fortifies Dorchester Heights with cannon, leading the British troops to abandon the Siege of Boston.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: The Continental Army fortifies Dorchester Heights with cannon, leading the British troops to abandon the Siege of Boston.

Events.text: In New York City, the first Congress of the United States meets, putting the United States Constitution into effect. The United States Bill of Rights is written and proposed to Congress.
Events.html: In New York City, the first Congress of the United States meets, putting the United States Constitution into effect. The United States Bill of Rights is written and proposed to Congress.

Events.text: France is divided into 83 départements, cutting across the former provinces in an attempt to dislodge regional loyalties based on ownership of land by the nobility.
Events.html: France is divided into 83 départements, cutting across the former provinces in an attempt to dislodge regional loyalties based on ownership of land by the nobility.

Events.text: The Constitutional Act of 1791 is introduced by the British House of Commons in London which envisages the separation of Canada into Lower Canada (Quebec) and Upper Canada (Ontario).
Events.html: The Constitutional Act of 1791 is introduced by the British House of Commons in London which envisages the separation of Canada into Lower Canada (Quebec) and Upper Canada (Ontario).

links.title: House of Commons of the United Kingdom

Events.text: Vermont is admitted to the United States as the fourteenth state.
Events.html: Vermont is admitted to the United States as the fourteenth state.

Events.text: The 11th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution is passed by the U.S. Congress.
Events.html: The 11th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution is passed by the U.S. Congress.

links.title: Eleventh Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.text: John Adams is inaugurated as the 2nd President of the United States of America, becoming the first President to begin his presidency on March 4.

Events.text: Castle Hill Rebellion: Irish convicts rebel against British colonial authority in the Colony of New South Wales.
Events.html: Castle Hill Rebellion: Irish convicts rebel against British colonial authority in the Colony of New South Wales.

Events.text: Cyril VI of Constantinople is elected Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople.
Events.html: Cyril VI of Constantinople is elected Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople.

Events.text: Americans defeat British forces at the Battle of Longwoods between London, Ontario and Thamesville, near present-day Wardsville, Ontario.
Events.html: Americans defeat British forces at the Battle of Longwoods between London, Ontario and Thamesville, near present-day Wardsville, Ontario.

Events.text: The city of Chicago is incorporated.
Events.html: The city of Chicago is incorporated.

Events.text: Carlo Alberto di Savoia signs the Statuto Albertino that will later represent the first constitution of the Regno d'Italia.
Events.html: Carlo Alberto di Savoia signs the Statuto Albertino that will later represent the first constitution of the Regno d'Italia.

Events.text: The first national flag of the Confederate States of America (the "Stars and Bars") is adopted.
Events.html: The first national flag of the Confederate States of America (the "Stars and Bars") is adopted.

Events.text: The third and final national flag of the Confederate States of America is adopted by the Confederate Congress.
Events.html: The third and final national flag of the Confederate States of America is adopted by the Confederate Congress.

Events.text: Britain's first electric trams run in east London.
Events.html: Britain's first electric trams run in east London.

Events.text: The longest bridge in Great Britain, the Forth Bridge in Scotland, measuring 1,710 feet (520 m) long, is opened by the Prince of Wales, later King Edward VII.
Events.html: The longest bridge in Great Britain, the Forth Bridge in Scotland, measuring 1,710 feet (520 m) long, is opened by the Prince of Wales, later King Edward VII.

Events.text: Cyclone Mahina sweeps in north of Cooktown, Queensland, with a 12 metres (39 ft) wave that reaches up to 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) inland, killing over 300.
Events.html: Cyclone Mahina sweeps in north of Cooktown, Queensland, with a 12 metres (39 ft) wave that reaches up to 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) inland, killing over 300.

Events.text: The Collinwood school fire, Collinwood near Cleveland, Ohio, kills 174 people.
Events.html: The Collinwood school fire, Collinwood near Cleveland, Ohio, kills 174 people.

Events.text: U.S. President William Taft used what became known as a Saxbe fix, a mechanism to avoid the restriction of the U.S. Constitution's Ineligibility Clause, to appoint Philander C. Knox as U.S. Secretary of State
Events.html: U.S. President William Taft used what became known as a Saxbe fix, a mechanism to avoid the restriction of the U.S. Constitution's Ineligibility Clause, to appoint Philander C. Knox as U.S. Secretary of State

Events.text: First Balkan War: The Greek army engages the Turks at Bizani, resulting in victory two days later.
Events.html: First Balkan War: The Greek army engages the Turks at Bizani, resulting in victory two days later.

Events.text: The United States Department of Labor is formed.
Events.html: 1913 – The United States Department of Labor is formed.

Events.text: Jeannette Rankin of Montana becomes the first female member of the United States House of Representatives.
Events.html: Jeannette Rankin of Montana becomes the first female member of the United States House of Representatives.

Events.text: Frances Perkins becomes United States Secretary of Labor, the first female member of the United States Cabinet.
Events.html: Frances Perkins becomes United States Secretary of Labor, the first female member of the United States Cabinet.

Events.text: The Parliament of Austria is suspended because of a quibble over procedure – Chancellor Engelbert Dollfuss initiates an authoritarian rule by decree.
Events.html: 1933 – The Parliament of Austria is suspended because of a quibble over procedure – Chancellor Engelbert Dollfuss initiates an authoritarian rule by decree.

Events.text: World War II: The United Kingdom launches Operation Claymore on the Lofoten Islands; the first large scale British Commando raid.
Events.html: World War II: The United Kingdom launches Operation Claymore on the Lofoten Islands; the first large scale British Commando raid.

Events.text: World War II: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea in the south-west Pacific comes to an end.
Events.html: World War II: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea in the south-west Pacific comes to an end.

Events.text: World War II: After the success of Big Week, the USAAF begins a daylight bombing campaign of Berlin.
Events.html: World War II: After the success of Big Week, the USAAF begins a daylight bombing campaign of Berlin.

links.title: Bombing of Berlin in World War II

Events.text: The S&P 500 stock market index is introduced, replacing the S&P 90.
Events.html: The S&P 500 stock market index is introduced, replacing the S&P 90.

Events.text: The French freighter La Coubre explodes in Havana, Cuba, killing 100.
Events.html: The French freighter La Coubre explodes in Havana, Cuba, killing 100.

Events.text: A Caledonian Airways Douglas DC-7 crashes shortly after takeoff from Cameroon, killing 111 – the worst crash of a DC-7.
Events.html: A Caledonian Airways Douglas DC-7 crashes shortly after takeoff from Cameroon, killing 111 – the worst crash of a DC-7.

Events.text: A Canadian Pacific Air Lines DC-8-43 explodes on landing at Tokyo International Airport, killing 64 people.
Events.html: A Canadian Pacific Air Lines DC-8-43 explodes on landing at Tokyo International Airport, killing 64 people.

Events.text: French submarine Eurydice explodes underwater, resulting in the loss of the entire 57-man crew.
Events.html: French submarine Eurydice explodes underwater, resulting in the loss of the entire 57-man crew.

Events.text: People magazine is published for the first time in the United States as People Weekly.
Events.html: People magazine is published for the first time in the United States as People Weekly.

Events.text: The Northern Ireland Constitutional Convention is formally dissolved in Northern Ireland resulting in direct rule of Northern Ireland from London by the British parliament.
Events.html: The Northern Ireland Constitutional Convention is formally dissolved in Northern Ireland resulting in direct rule of Northern Ireland from London by the British parliament.

Events.text: The 1977 Vrancea earthquake in eastern and southern Europe kills more than 1,500, mostly in Bucharest, Romania.
Events.html: The 1977 Vrancea earthquake in eastern and southern Europe kills more than 1,500, mostly in Bucharest, Romania.

Events.text: Nationalist leader Robert Mugabe wins a sweeping election victory to become Zimbabwe's first black prime minister.
Events.html: Nationalist leader Robert Mugabe wins a sweeping election victory to become Zimbabwe's first black prime minister.

Events.html: The Food and Drug Administration approves a blood test for AIDS infection, used since then for screening all blood donations in the United States.

Events.text: The Soviet Vega 1 begins returning images of Halley's Comet and the first images of its nucleus.
Events.html: The Soviet Vega 1 begins returning images of Halley's Comet and the first images of its nucleus.

Events.text: A derailed train in Weyauwega, Wisconsin (USA) causes the emergency evacuation of 2,300 people for 16 days.
Events.html: A derailed train in Weyauwega, Wisconsin (USA) causes the emergency evacuation of 2,300 people for 16 days.

Events.text: Gay rights: Oncale v. Sundowner Offshore Services, Inc.: The Supreme Court of the United States rules that federal laws banning on-the-job sexual harassment also apply when both parties are the same sex.

Events.text: BBC bombing: A massive car bomb explodes in front of the BBC Television Centre in London, seriously injuring one person; the attack was attributed to the Real IRA.
Events.html: BBC bombing: A massive car bomb explodes in front of the BBC Television Centre in London, seriously injuring one person; the attack was attributed to the Real IRA.

Events.text: Afghanistan: Seven American Special Operations Forces soldiers and 200 Al-Qaeda Fighters are killed as American forces attempt to infiltrate the Shah-i-Kot Valley on a low-flying helicopter reconnaissance mission.
